_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText: The Airgas South Dothan facility, owned and operated by Airgas South, Inc. is located at 498 Ross Clark Circle Dothan, AL 36303. The management and employees of the Dothan facility are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of Acetylene. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, or other authorities to mitigate the any release and minimize the impact of the release to the community and the environment.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  The facilities primary operation is the storage and distribution of Chlorine Gas. Chlorine is delivered in trailers containing a large number ofcylinders manifolded togethe.  Cylinders are removed from the trailer and placed into storage for shipment.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Airgas South manages the safety of the regulated process by means of operating procedures, equipment testing and inspections, safety devices (e.g. alarms, shutdowns, instrumentation, relief devices) inherent in the design of the facility and other controls and systems designed to prevent accidental release of hazardous chemicals. Safe work practices and training of our personnel supplement the inherent safe design of the plant.

Our emergency response program is based upon OSHA's HAZWOPER regulation. The emergency response plan includes procedures for the notification of the local fire authority and Hazardous materials unit so that the approriate measures can be taken by the local emergency responders to control accidental releases.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       This document has been prepared in accordance with the EPA's RMP regulation (40 CFR, part 68). The substances and processes considered during the preparation of this RMP and the scenarios described were selected based on criteria established in the regulation.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        The facility developed prevention program elements are based on the Federal EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Plan, and OSHA's Process Safrety Management (PSM) regulation. This facility was designed and constructed to comply with applicable state and industry codes.

There have been no accidents involving or accidental releases of product that have resulted in deaths, injuries, or property damage on site, or known off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          At this site, employees are trained to recognize emergencies and initiate emergency response from outside agencies. The facility has an Emergency response plan which has been integrated with the local community Emergency Response Plan. All employees and contractors are trained in the plan prior to commencement of work. The Emergency Plan is tested and critiqued twice a year to insure that it is current.
